sprite.name: Mini Goomba
sprite.notes: A Tiny Goomba that will walk forward and die upon contact with the player.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Goomba placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Tile God Event
sprite.notes: The Tile God can Create / Change / Destroy tiles within a specified area when an Event is activated.

dependency.notes: The Tile God sprite can be placed no more than one block outside of the Zone it is being activated in for it to function.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the tiles affected by the Tile God's area will be created or destroyed, depending on the Mode.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the area that is affected.

value.title: Height
value.comment: This determines the height of the area that is affected.

list.title: Target Layer
list.comment: This determines which terrain layer is affected.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is activated.
dualbox.comment2: When creating, the Tile God will place these tiles on top of existing tiles instead of replacing them.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is deactivated
dualbox.comment2: When set to Reverse, previously created tiles will be destroyed, and locations where tiles were destroyed will be filled by the creation settings of the Tile God.

checkbox.title: Disable Effects
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the visual effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.
checkbox.comment2: You can use the Effect/Sound Spawner (483) to add your own effect in its place.

checkbox.title: Disable Sounds
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the sound effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.
checkbox.comment2: You can use the Effect/Sound Spawner (483) to add your own sound in its place.

list.title: Pattern
list.comment: This determines the fill pattern for the Tile God's selected area.
list.comment2: A checkered pattern and reverse checked pattern overlapping will create the same effect as a regular fill. This is sometimes useful for its visual effect.

list.title: Shard Effect
list.comment: This determines what shard spawns when the block is destroyed. If none, it will spawn the original poof effect.

list.title: Tile
list.comment: This determines what terrain tile will appear at the Tile God's selected area

value.title: Tileset Row
value.comment: When using [Tile: Tile from Pa(x)], you can spawn every tile from the tileset by selecting it from a grid formation. Each tileset contains 16 Rows (0-15), and 16 Columns (0-15). The first tile in the top left is 0,0 and the last tile in the bottom right is 15,15.
value.comment2:
Some common examples for Pa0:
Coin: 1,14 | Coin Outline: 1,15 | ?-Block: 3,1 | Used Block: 3,2 | Wooden Block: 3,3 | Stone Block: 3,4 | Donut Lift: 3,5 | Steel Block: 3,6

value.title: Tileset Column
value.comment: When using [Block Type: Tile from Pa(x)], you can spawn every tile from the tileset by selecting it from a grid formation. Each tileset contains 16 Rows (0-15), and 16 Columns (0-15). The first tile in the top left is 0,0 and the last tile in the bottom right is 15,15.
value.comment2:
Some common examples for Pa0:
Coin: 1,14 | Coin Outline: 1,15 | ?-Block: 3,1 | Used Block: 3,2 | Wooden Block: 3,3 | Stone Block: 3,4 | Donut Lift: 3,5 | Steel Block: 3,6

sprite.name: Jumbo Ray Respawner 2
sprite.notes: A controller that will respawn or otherwise spawn additional Jumbo Rays.

value.title: Ray ID
value.comment: This determines which Jumbo Rays will be respawned by this controller.

value.title: Spawn Delay While Ridden
value.comment: This determines how soon after the launch of the initial Jumbo Ray that another one will be spawned. Used whenever at least one Ray is being ridden by a player.
value.comment2: A value of 16 is equal to about the width of one Jumbo Ray. <font color="red">Do not use a value of 0 or the game will crash.</font>

value.title: Spawn Delay While Not Ridden
value.comment: Used instead of the other Spawn Delay whenever no Rays are currently being ridden.

sprite.name: Climbing Koopa - Cliffs
sprite.notes: Koopas that hang from cliff edges and shimmy across them.
sprite.advancednotes: This sprite's constructor (and the sprite settings) was removed from the vanilla game and has been restored. There may have been more settings for this sprite at one point.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Cliff Koopa will mindlessly walk off of ledges or if it will turn around when it reaches a ledge.
dualbox.comment2: This also changes the color of the Cliff Koopa.

dualbox.comment: This determines what direction the Cliff Koopa will spawn.

checkbox.title: Spawn Locaton Fix
checkbox.comment: by default, this sprite is placed too low to be useful. This setting will spawn them properly.

sprite.name: Signboard - Arrow
sprite.notes: A signboard with a red arrow on it, useful for suggesting a player travel in a specific direction.

list.title: Rotation
list.comment: This determines which direction the sign will face.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the arrow will point in.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Signboard placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Actor Spawner
sprite.notes: Spawns an actor on event trigger.

value.title: Actor ID
value.comment: Can only spawn actors with ID values 0-1023.

sprite.name: Actor Multi Spawner
sprite.notes: Spawns an actor every 3 seconds while an event is triggered.

value.title: Actor ID
value.comment: Can only spawn actors with ID values 0-1023.

sprite.name: Paired Actor Spawner
sprite.notes: Spawns an actor on event trigger. When the triggered event is disabled, the actor will despawn.

value.title: Actor ID
value.comment: Can only spawn actors with ID values 0-1023.

sprite.name: Basic Platform - Water
sprite.notes: This platform floats on water. Can follow the current set by sprite 243.
sprite.advancenotes: Does not work with location water.

sprite.name: Shy Guy
sprite.notes: A walking Shy Guy. Can be set to turn at ledges, pace a specified distance, sleep, or bounce up and down.

list.title: Type
list.comment: Types greater than 4 spawn Shy Guys that won't move.

list.title: Color
list.comment2: While you can set Shy Guys to any color, it is recommended to keep Shy Guy types and colors consistent.

checkbox.title: Dies in 2 Stomps
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this causes the Shy Guy to die in 2 stomps instead of 1.
checkbox.comment2: It is recommended to keep this consistent across Shy Guy variants.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Shy Guy placing it further behind other sprites.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: The distance the Shy Guy will walk in each direction. The Shy Guy will ignore ledges.

sprite.name: Flip Block
sprite.notes: A yellow block with two eyes that can be destroyed by spin jumps. When struck, it will spin, allowing passage through it for a limited time.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release only one power-up item.

checkbox.title: Indestructible
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Flip Block will not be destroyed when Spin Jumped.
checkbox.comment2: It is recommended to keep this consistent across Flip Blocks.

sprite.name: Event Controller - ON/OFF Block
sprite.notes: A red or blue block that, when struck, will affect the state of the Target Event(s). Events that are deactivated will become activated, and those that are activated will become deactivated.

dualbox.comment: This determines which associated Event IDs will be affected when the block is struck.
dualbox.comment2:
If set to Affect Event 1, Event 1 will be activated or deactivated and the color of the block will display the state of Event 1, red for on and blue for off.

If set to Swap Events, Event 2 will be activated initially and Event 1 will be deactivated initially during the Zone loading. The color of the block will rely on Event 2's current state.

sprite.name: Nipper Plant
sprite.notes: A small plant resembling a muncher with a white head that will jump to reach players above.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Nipper Plant will stay in place or move around.
dualbox.comment2: The plant will still jump to the player no matter the movement type.

list.title: Jump Height
list.comment: The Nipper Plant will always have the same detection radius (6 tiles).

checkbox.title: Spits Fire
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Nipper Plant will spit fireballs when the player is nearby.

checkbox.title: Frozen
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Nipper Plant will spawn frozen. It can be thawed with a fireball.

sprite.name: Message Block
sprite.notes: A block that the player can hit which will display a custom message. Messages are defined in Message.arc.

value.title: Message ID
value.comment2: The category for the title is 400. The category for the text is 401. The ID is the last 2 digits of the message entry.
